raw_text:
Mourinho receives Robson warning
 
 Sir Bobby Robson has offered Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho some advice on coping under pressure.
 
 The pair worked together at Barcelona and Porto and Robson had a word of warning for his protege. "It has all gone for him just lately and that is marvellous, but sometimes you have to have a bit of humility and learn how to lose," said Robson. "It is when it goes against you and you get a bit of bad luck that you learn, and he'll get it straight." Robson was speaking after being formally granted the freedom of the city of Newcastle. "Jose is doing very well at the moment," Robson added of the man who worked for him for six years. "He has got one pot - possibly two to follow - a big game against Barcelona to come and I cannot see them losing their lead in the Premiership. "They are in a good position and I would expect them to go on and win it, which is a wonderful achievement.
 
 "What has occurred over the last couple of weeks will stand him in very good stead for the future. If he is intelligent, he will take it on board - and he is very intelligent. "He will have learned more in the last fortnight than the last eight months. Before that, it was all about winning." Robson also admitted he would relish the chance to get back into management and test his skills against Mourinho. "I am not in a hurry to take the wrong job, but I am ready to take the right job and I feel there is another job in me," he added. "I know the area I am capable of working in and of course I would like a job in the Premiership if one was available. "It would not worry me if I had to pit my wits against Jose. "But it is not just a case of him and me against one another. It would be his team against my team - but I would not be afraid of that."
llama3.2:1b: Sir Bobby Robson warns Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho about the importance of humility and learning from failures, having worked with him at Barcelona and Porto.
Robson praises Mourinho's performance despite recent setbacks, noting he has one key game ahead and expects a win against Barcelona to cement his team's lead in the Premier League.
llama3.2:3b: Sir Bobby Robson advised Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho on humility and learning how to lose, saying he'll take the lessons from recent struggles in stride and is intelligent enough to do so.
Robson believes Mourinho will continue to excel and win the Premiership title.
He also expressed his own desire to return to management, feeling he could do another job well, particularly in the Premiership, and sees a rivalry with Mourinho as a possibility.
gemma2:2b: Sir Bobby Robson gave Jose Mourinho advice on dealing with pressure, urging him to learn from losses.
He believes Mourinho has reached a good position but will benefit from facing adversity.
Robson expressed his readiness for a new management role and expressed his interest in coaching against Mourinho's Chelsea team.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Jose Mourinho has given Robson advice on playing under pressure, emphasizing the importance of humility and learning from setbacks.
Mourinho offered to grant Robson the freedom of the city of Newcastle for 6 months free of a salary cap.
Mourinho is looking to take Robson back into management to test his skills against Jose Mourinho.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Former Chelsea manager Mourinho receives advice on dealing with pressure from former player Robson, emphasizing the importance of learning to lose as well as maintaining humility.
qwen2.5:3b: Sir Bobby Robson, former manager of Chelsea, warned Jose Mourinho about needing humility in the face of pressure.
Robson noted Mourinho's recent success but advised he should learn from losses and bad luck.
Despite praising Mourinho’s current performance and outlook for a Premiership victory, Robson admitted he would enjoy the challenge of managing against Mourinho again.
He expressed readiness to take on any suitable management role, including one at the Premiership level.

They are in a good position and I would expect them to go on and win it which is a wonderful achievement "What has occurred over the last couple of weeks will stand him in very good stead for the future" If he is intelligent, he will take it on board - and he is very intelligent He will have learned more in the last fortnight than the last eight months Before that, it was all about winning Robson also admitted he would relish the chance to get back into management and test his skills against Mourinho "I am not in a hurry to take the wrong job, but I am ready to take the right job and I feel there is another job in me" He added before that, it was all about winning.
But it would be his team against my team - but I would not be afraid of that."
smollm:1.7b: Mourinho receives Robson's warning, which is about the importance of humility in coping with pressure and learning from mistakes.
He also advises Jose Mourinho to learn how to lose and take responsibility for one's actions.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Rob basketball player Bobby Robson has given manager Jose Mourinho some advice: "It was just a great move, but losing isn't bad—it teaches humility.
When you lose, they can get you down."
Robson spoke after receiving the freedom of Newcastle.
"Jose is doing well," he said of his coach who had been with him for six years at Barcelona and Porto.
"He has two big games in their first league season to come against them and I don't see any issues there.
"The team is in a good position, ready to take another win.
He will learn more in the next fortnight than he did in the last eight months."
Robson also admits he'll play it safe by moving into management to test his skills.
He's not in a hurry to leave, but he wants to succeed where Mourinho is.
"I know the team I can manage and I want a spot at the Premiership if available.
"It won't be easy if we have to fight for that."
tinyllama:1.1b: Sir Bobby Robson has given Jose Mourirho some advice on coping under pressure, emphasizing the importance of learning how to lose and adapting to the situation.
Robson believes that Mourirdo will benefit from his previous experience at Barcelona and Porto, which he acknowledged when granting him with the freedom of Newcastle.
The coach explained that Mourirdo is doing well right now, but has learned some valuable lessons from past experiences.
When asked if he would take on the job of a manager for a Premier team, Robson revealed his desire to work again in this area and test himself against Mourirdo.
However, as Robson is ready to take on any challenge that comes his way, including working with Mourirdo should he be offered a chance.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Jose Mourinho has received a warning from Sir Bobby Robson about coping under pressure, which suggests he may need to learn how to lose in order to succeed.
This statement comes after Mourinho's impressive start as Chelsea's boss, having earned the respect of his teammates and opponents alike.
It also indicates that Robson is willing to take on any challenge, even if it means facing his former charge at one of the most successful clubs in European football history.
phi:2.7b: Sir Bobby Robson warns Chelsea boss Jose Mourinho about being humble after a string of good results.
However, he also expresses confidence in Mourinho's skills and readiness to take on new challenges.
He mentions the upcoming game against Barcelona as an opportunity for them to maintain their lead and believes Mourinho has learned from past experiences.

hermes3:3b: Jose Mourinho gets Robson's advice on coping with pressure, after working together; Robson warns about having humility and learning how to lose sometimes, which will stand Mourinho in good stead for future.

Robson believes Mourinho is intelligent and will benefit from the experience.
He also expresses interest in returning to management and facing off against Mourinho in a future job opportunity.

Robson, who previously worked with Mourinho at Barcelona and Porto, acknowledged Mourinho's success but warned that challenges would come.

Robson noted that recent experiences would benefit Mourinho's growth and learning.

stablelm2:1.6b: Sir Bobby Robson gives advice to Jose Mourinho, warning him about coping under pressure and suggesting that humility and learning how to lose are important skills.
Robson praised Mourinho for his success at Chelsea, but also acknowledged the importance of bad luck and loss in learning.
Robson expressed interest in returning to management and said he would be ready for the right opportunity, with a preference for working in the Premiership if available.
He did not fear facing Mourinho's team alone or as part of a larger competition.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Sir Bobby Robson, Chelsea's former manager who worked with current boss Jose Mourinho at Barcelona and Porto, offered advice on maintaining humility and learning to handle losses.
Robson praised Mourinino's recent success but warned him that setbacks are inevitable for any team.
Despite Chelsea's strong position in the Premiership with a potential match against Barcelona ahead, Robson believed Mourinho would learn valuable lessons from adversity.

Reflecting on his own potential return to management, Robson expressed readiness to challenge Mourinho again, emphasizing that it wouldn't be just about their individual skills but also their respective teams' performance.
